summary:
Returns input token counts of the request.

Returns an object with `object` set to `response.input_tokens` and an `input_tokens` count.

anyOf.description: Text, image, or file inputs to the model, used to generate a response

oneOf.description: A text input to the model, equivalent to a text input with the `user` role.
A list of one or many input items to the model, containing different content types.

anyOf.description:
A system (or developer) message inserted into the model's context.
When used along with `previous_response_id`, the instructions from a previous response will not be carried over to the next response. This makes it simple to swap out system (or developer) messages in new responses.

Model ID used to generate the response, like `gpt-4o` or `o3`. OpenAI offers a wide range of models with different capabilities, performance characteristics, and price points. Refer to the [model guide](/docs/models) to browse and compare available models.
Whether to allow the model to run tool calls in parallel.

The unique ID of the previous response to the model. Use this to create multi-turn conversations. Learn more about [conversation state](/docs/guides/conversation-state). Cannot be used in conjunction with `conversation`.
**gpt-5 and o-series models only** Configuration options for [reasoning models](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning).
Controls which tool the model should use, if any.
An array of tools the model may call while generating a response. You can specify which tool to use by setting the `tool_choice` parameter.

truncation.description: The truncation strategy to use for the model response. - `auto`: If the input to this Response exceeds the model's context window size, the model will truncate the response to fit the context window by dropping items from the beginning of the conversation. - `disabled` (default): If the input size will exceed the context window size for a model, the request will fail with a 400 error.

ConversationParam.description:
The conversation that this response belongs to. Items from this conversation are prepended to `input_items` for this response request.
Input items and output items from this response are automatically added to this conversation after this response completes.

oneOf.description: The unique ID of the conversation.
oneOf.title: Conversation ID

oneOf.description:
An item representing part of the context for the response to be
generated by the model. Can contain text, images, and audio inputs,
as well as previous assistant responses and tool call outputs.
oneOf.title: Item

Reasoning.description:
**gpt-5 and o-series models only**

Configuration options for
[reasoning models](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning).

anyOf.description:
**Deprecated:** use `summary` instead.

A summary of the reasoning performed by the model. This can be
useful for debugging and understanding the model's reasoning process.
One of `auto`, `concise`, or `detailed`.

A summary of the reasoning performed by the model. This can be
useful for debugging and understanding the model's reasoning process.
One of `auto`, `concise`, or `detailed`.

`concise` is supported for `computer-use-preview` models and all reasoning models after `gpt-5`.

Reasoning.title: Reasoning

ResponseTextParam.description:
Configuration options for a text response from the model. Can be plain
text or structured JSON data. Learn more:
- [Text inputs and outputs](/docs/guides/text)
- [Structured Outputs](/docs/guides/structured-outputs)

ToolChoiceParam.description:
How the model should select which tool (or tools) to use when generating
a response. See the `tools` parameter to see how to specify which tools
the model can call.

Tool.description: A tool that can be used to generate a response.

ConversationParam-2.description: The conversation that this response belongs to.

id.description: The unique ID of the conversation.

ConversationParam-2.title: Conversation object

EasyInputMessage.description:
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role. Messages with the
`assistant` role are presumed to have been generated by the model in previous
interactions.

content.description:
Text, image, or audio input to the model, used to generate a response.
Can also contain previous assistant responses.

oneOf.description: A text input to the model.
oneOf.title: Text input

role.description:
The role of the message input. One of `user`, `assistant`, `system`, or
`developer`.

type.description: The type of the message input. Always `message`.

EasyInputMessage.title: Input message

Item.description: Content item used to generate a response.

ItemReferenceParam.description: An internal identifier for an item to reference.

id.description: The ID of the item to reference.

anyOf.description: The type of item to reference. Always `item_reference`.

ItemReferenceParam.title: Item reference

anyOf.description:
Constrains effort on reasoning for
[reasoning models](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning).
Currently supported values are `none`, `minimal`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, and `xhigh`. Reducing
reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used
on reasoning in a response.

- `gpt-5.1` defaults to `none`, which does not perform reasoning. The supported reasoning values for `gpt-5.1` are `none`, `low`, `medium`, and `high`. Tool calls are supported for all reasoning values in gpt-5.1.
- All models before `gpt-5.1` default to `medium` reasoning effort, and do not support `none`.
- The `gpt-5-pro` model defaults to (and only supports) `high` reasoning effort.
- `xhigh` is supported for all models after `gpt-5.1-codex-max`.

TextResponseFormatConfiguration.description:
An object specifying the format that the model must output.

Configuring `{ "type": "json_schema" }` enables Structured Outputs, 
which ensures the model will match your supplied JSON schema. Learn more in the 
[Structured Outputs guide](/docs/guides/structured-outputs).

The default format is `{ "type": "text" }` with no additional options.

**Not recommended for gpt-4o and newer models:**

Setting to `{ "type": "json_object" }` enables the older JSON mode, which
ensures the message the model generates is valid JSON. Using `json_schema`
is preferred for models that support it.

anyOf.description:
Constrains the verbosity of the model's response. Lower values will result in
more concise responses, while higher values will result in more verbose responses.
Currently supported values are `low`, `medium`, and `high`.

ToolChoiceOptions.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model.

`none` means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message.

`auto` means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or
more tools.

`required` means the model must call one or more tools.
ToolChoiceOptions.title: Tool choice mode

ToolChoiceAllowed.description: Constrains the tools available to the model to a pre-defined set.

mode.description:
Constrains the tools available to the model to a pre-defined set.

`auto` allows the model to pick from among the allowed tools and generate a
message.

`required` requires the model to call one or more of the allowed tools.

tools.description:
A list of tool definitions that the model should be allowed to call.

For the Responses API, the list of tool definitions might look like:
```json
[
  { "type": "function", "name": "get_weather" },
  { "type": "mcp", "server_label": "deepwiki" },
  { "type": "image_generation" }
]
```

items.description: A tool definition that the model should be allowed to call.

type.description: Allowed tool configuration type. Always `allowed_tools`.

ToolChoiceAllowed.title: Allowed tools

ToolChoiceTypes.description:
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.
[Learn more about built-in tools](/docs/guides/tools).

type.description:
The type of hosted tool the model should to use. Learn more about
[built-in tools](/docs/guides/tools).

Allowed values are:
- `file_search`
- `web_search_preview`
- `computer_use_preview`
- `code_interpreter`
- `image_generation`

ToolChoiceTypes.title: Hosted tool

ToolChoiceFunction.description: Use this option to force the model to call a specific function.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

type.description: For function calling, the type is always `function`.

ToolChoiceFunction.title: Function tool

ToolChoiceMCP.description: Use this option to force the model to call a specific tool on a remote MCP server.

anyOf.description: The name of the tool to call on the server.

server_label.description: The label of the MCP server to use.

type.description: For MCP tools, the type is always `mcp`.

ToolChoiceMCP.title: MCP tool

ToolChoiceCustom.description: Use this option to force the model to call a specific custom tool.

name.description: The name of the custom tool to call.

type.description: For custom tool calling, the type is always `custom`.

ToolChoiceCustom.title: Custom tool

SpecificApplyPatchParam.description: Forces the model to call the apply_patch tool when executing a tool call.

type.description: The tool to call. Always `apply_patch`.

SpecificApplyPatchParam.title: Specific apply patch tool choice

SpecificFunctionShellParam.description: Forces the model to call the shell tool when a tool call is required.

type.description: The tool to call. Always `shell`.

SpecificFunctionShellParam.title: Specific shell tool choice

FunctionTool.description: Defines a function in your own code the model can choose to call. Learn more about [function calling](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling).

anyOf.description: A description of the function. Used by the model to determine whether or not to call the function.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

anyOf.description: A JSON schema object describing the parameters of the function.
Whether to enforce strict parameter validation. Default `true`.

type.description: The type of the function tool. Always `function`.

FunctionTool.title: Function

FileSearchTool.description: A tool that searches for relevant content from uploaded files. Learn more about the [file search tool](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-file-search).

anyOf.description: A filter to apply.

max_num_results.description: The maximum number of results to return. This number should be between 1 and 50 inclusive.

type.description: The type of the file search tool. Always `file_search`.

vector_store_ids.description: The IDs of the vector stores to search.

FileSearchTool.title: File search

ComputerUsePreviewTool.description: A tool that controls a virtual computer. Learn more about the [computer tool](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-computer-use).

display_height.description: The height of the computer display.

display_width.description: The width of the computer display.

environment.description: The type of computer environment to control.

type.description: The type of the computer use tool. Always `computer_use_preview`.

ComputerUsePreviewTool.title: Computer use preview

WebSearchTool.description:
Search the Internet for sources related to the prompt. Learn more about the
[web search tool](/docs/guides/tools-web-search).

anyOf.description: Filters for the search.

Allowed domains for the search. If not provided, all domains are allowed.
Subdomains of the provided domains are allowed as well.

Example: `["pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov"]`
anyOf.title: Allowed domains for the search.

search_context_size.description: High level guidance for the amount of context window space to use for the search. One of `low`, `medium`, or `high`. `medium` is the default.

type.description: The type of the web search tool. One of `web_search` or `web_search_2025_08_26`.

WebSearchTool.title: Web search

MCPTool.description:
Give the model access to additional tools via remote Model Context Protocol
(MCP) servers. [Learn more about MCP](/docs/guides/tools-remote-mcp).

anyOf.description: List of allowed tool names or a filter object.

oneOf.description: A string array of allowed tool names
oneOf.title: MCP allowed tools

authorization.description:
An OAuth access token that can be used with a remote MCP server, either
with a custom MCP server URL or a service connector. Your application
must handle the OAuth authorization flow and provide the token here.

connector_id.description:
Identifier for service connectors, like those available in ChatGPT. One of
`server_url` or `connector_id` must be provided. Learn more about service
connectors [here](/docs/guides/tools-remote-mcp#connectors).

Currently supported `connector_id` values are:

- Dropbox: `connector_dropbox`
- Gmail: `connector_gmail`
- Google Calendar: `connector_googlecalendar`
- Google Drive: `connector_googledrive`
- Microsoft Teams: `connector_microsoftteams`
- Outlook Calendar: `connector_outlookcalendar`
- Outlook Email: `connector_outlookemail`
- SharePoint: `connector_sharepoint`

anyOf.description:
Optional HTTP headers to send to the MCP server. Use for authentication
or other purposes.
Specify which of the MCP server's tools require approval.

oneOf.description:
Specify which of the MCP server's tools require approval. Can be
`always`, `never`, or a filter object associated with tools
that require approval.
oneOf.title: MCP tool approval filter

oneOf.description:
Specify a single approval policy for all tools. One of `always` or
`never`. When set to `always`, all tools will require approval. When
set to `never`, all tools will not require approval.
oneOf.title: MCP tool approval setting

server_description.description: Optional description of the MCP server, used to provide more context.

server_label.description: A label for this MCP server, used to identify it in tool calls.

server_url.description:
The URL for the MCP server. One of `server_url` or `connector_id` must be
provided.

type.description: The type of the MCP tool. Always `mcp`.

MCPTool.title: MCP tool

CodeInterpreterTool.description: A tool that runs Python code to help generate a response to a prompt.

container.description:
The code interpreter container. Can be a container ID or an object that
specifies uploaded file IDs to make available to your code, along with an
optional `memory_limit` setting.

type.description: The type of the code interpreter tool. Always `code_interpreter`.

CodeInterpreterTool.title: Code interpreter

ImageGenTool.description: A tool that generates images using the GPT image models.

action.description: Whether to generate a new image or edit an existing image. Default: `auto`.

background.description:
Background type for the generated image. One of `transparent`,
`opaque`, or `auto`. Default: `auto`.

input_image_mask.description:
Optional mask for inpainting. Contains `image_url`
(string, optional) and `file_id` (string, optional).

file_id.description: File ID for the mask image.

anyOf.description: The image generation model to use. Default: `gpt-image-1`.

moderation.description: Moderation level for the generated image. Default: `auto`.

output_compression.description: Compression level for the output image. Default: 100.

output_format.description:
The output format of the generated image. One of `png`, `webp`, or
`jpeg`. Default: `png`.

partial_images.description: Number of partial images to generate in streaming mode, from 0 (default value) to 3.

quality.description:
The quality of the generated image. One of `low`, `medium`, `high`,
or `auto`. Default: `auto`.

size.description:
The size of the generated image. One of `1024x1024`, `1024x1536`,
`1536x1024`, or `auto`. Default: `auto`.

type.description: The type of the image generation tool. Always `image_generation`.

ImageGenTool.title: Image generation tool

LocalShellToolParam.description: A tool that allows the model to execute shell commands in a local environment.

type.description: The type of the local shell tool. Always `local_shell`.

LocalShellToolParam.title: Local shell tool

FunctionShellToolParam.description: A tool that allows the model to execute shell commands.

type.description: The type of the shell tool. Always `shell`.

FunctionShellToolParam.title: Shell tool

CustomToolParam.description: A custom tool that processes input using a specified format. Learn more about   [custom tools](/docs/guides/function-calling#custom-tools)

description.description: Optional description of the custom tool, used to provide more context.

format.description: The input format for the custom tool. Default is unconstrained text.

name.description: The name of the custom tool, used to identify it in tool calls.

type.description: The type of the custom tool. Always `custom`.

CustomToolParam.title: Custom tool

WebSearchPreviewTool.description: This tool searches the web for relevant results to use in a response. Learn more about the [web search tool](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-web-search).

search_context_size.description: High level guidance for the amount of context window space to use for the search. One of `low`, `medium`, or `high`. `medium` is the default.

type.description: The type of the web search tool. One of `web_search_preview` or `web_search_preview_2025_03_11`.

anyOf.description: The user's location.

WebSearchPreviewTool.title: Web search preview

ApplyPatchToolParam.description: Allows the assistant to create, delete, or update files using unified diffs.

type.description: The type of the tool. Always `apply_patch`.

ApplyPatchToolParam.title: Apply patch tool

InputMessageContentList.description:
A list of one or many input items to the model, containing different content 
types.
InputMessageContentList.title: Input item content list

InputMessage.description:
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role.

role.description: The role of the message input. One of `user`, `system`, or `developer`.

status.description:
The status of item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the message input. Always set to `message`.

InputMessage.title: Input message

OutputMessage.description: An output message from the model.

content.description: The content of the output message.

id.description: The unique ID of the output message.

role.description: The role of the output message. Always `assistant`.

status.description:
The status of the message input. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when input items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the output message. Always `message`.

OutputMessage.title: Output message

FileSearchToolCall.description:
The results of a file search tool call. See the
[file search guide](/docs/guides/tools-file-search) for more information.

id.description: The unique ID of the file search tool call.

queries.description: The queries used to search for files.

anyOf.description: The results of the file search tool call.

file_id.description: The unique ID of the file.

score.description: The relevance score of the file - a value between 0 and 1.

text.description: The text that was retrieved from the file.

status.description:
The status of the file search tool call. One of `in_progress`,
`searching`, `incomplete` or `failed`,

type.description: The type of the file search tool call. Always `file_search_call`.

FileSearchToolCall.title: File search tool call

ComputerToolCall.description:
A tool call to a computer use tool. See the
[computer use guide](/docs/guides/tools-computer-use) for more information.

call_id.description: An identifier used when responding to the tool call with output.

id.description: The unique ID of the computer call.

pending_safety_checks.description: The pending safety checks for the computer call.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the computer call. Always `computer_call`.

ComputerToolCall.title: Computer tool call

ComputerCallOutputItemParam.description: The output of a computer tool call.

anyOf.description: The safety checks reported by the API that have been acknowledged by the developer.

call_id.description: The ID of the computer tool call that produced the output.

anyOf.description: The ID of the computer tool call output.
The status of the message input. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or `incomplete`. Populated when input items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the computer tool call output. Always `computer_call_output`.

ComputerCallOutputItemParam.title: Computer tool call output

WebSearchToolCall.description:
The results of a web search tool call. See the
[web search guide](/docs/guides/tools-web-search) for more information.

action.description:
An object describing the specific action taken in this web search call.
Includes details on how the model used the web (search, open_page, find_in_page).

id.description: The unique ID of the web search tool call.

status.description: The status of the web search tool call.

type.description: The type of the web search tool call. Always `web_search_call`.

WebSearchToolCall.title: Web search tool call

FunctionToolCall.description:
A tool call to run a function. See the 
[function calling guide](/docs/guides/function-calling) for more information.

arguments.description: A JSON string of the arguments to pass to the function.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call.

name.description: The name of the function to run.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the function tool call. Always `function_call`.

FunctionToolCall.title: Function tool call

FunctionCallOutputItemParam.description: The output of a function tool call.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

anyOf.description: The unique ID of the function tool call output. Populated when this item is returned via API.

output.description: Text, image, or file output of the function tool call.

oneOf.description: A JSON string of the output of the function tool call.
An array of content outputs (text, image, file) for the function tool call.

items.description: A piece of message content, such as text, an image, or a file.

anyOf.description: The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or `incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the function tool call output. Always `function_call_output`.

FunctionCallOutputItemParam.title: Function tool call output

ReasoningItem.description:
A description of the chain of thought used by a reasoning model while generating
a response. Be sure to include these items in your `input` to the Responses API
for subsequent turns of a conversation if you are manually
[managing context](/docs/guides/conversation-state).

anyOf.description:
The encrypted content of the reasoning item - populated when a response is
generated with `reasoning.encrypted_content` in the `include` parameter.

id.description: The unique identifier of the reasoning content.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the object. Always `reasoning`.

ReasoningItem.title: Reasoning

CompactionSummaryItemParam.description: A compaction item generated by the [`v1/responses/compact` API](/docs/api-reference/responses/compact).

encrypted_content.description: The encrypted content of the compaction summary.

anyOf.description: The ID of the compaction item.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `compaction`.

CompactionSummaryItemParam.title: Compaction item

ImageGenToolCall.description: An image generation request made by the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the image generation call.

anyOf.description: The generated image encoded in base64.

status.description: The status of the image generation call.

type.description: The type of the image generation call. Always `image_generation_call`.

ImageGenToolCall.title: Image generation call

CodeInterpreterToolCall.description: A tool call to run code.

anyOf.description: The code to run, or null if not available.

container_id.description: The ID of the container used to run the code.

id.description: The unique ID of the code interpreter tool call.

anyOf.description:
The outputs generated by the code interpreter, such as logs or images.
Can be null if no outputs are available.

status.description: The status of the code interpreter tool call. Valid values are `in_progress`, `completed`, `incomplete`, `interpreting`, and `failed`.

type.description: The type of the code interpreter tool call. Always `code_interpreter_call`.

CodeInterpreterToolCall.title: Code interpreter tool call

LocalShellToolCall.description: A tool call to run a command on the local shell.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the local shell tool call generated by the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the local shell call.

status.description: The status of the local shell call.

type.description: The type of the local shell call. Always `local_shell_call`.

LocalShellToolCall.title: Local shell call

LocalShellToolCallOutput.description: The output of a local shell tool call.

id.description: The unique ID of the local shell tool call generated by the model.

output.description: A JSON string of the output of the local shell tool call.

anyOf.description: The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or `incomplete`.

type.description: The type of the local shell tool call output. Always `local_shell_call_output`.

LocalShellToolCallOutput.title: Local shell call output

FunctionShellCallItemParam.description: A tool representing a request to execute one or more shell commands.

action.description: The shell commands and limits that describe how to run the tool call.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the shell tool call generated by the model.

anyOf.description: The environment to execute the shell commands in.
The unique ID of the shell tool call. Populated when this item is returned via API.
The status of the shell call. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or `incomplete`.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `shell_call`.

FunctionShellCallItemParam.title: Shell tool call

FunctionShellCallOutputItemParam.description: The streamed output items emitted by a shell tool call.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the shell tool call generated by the model.

anyOf.description: The unique ID of the shell tool call output. Populated when this item is returned via API.
The maximum number of UTF-8 characters captured for this shell call's combined output.

output.description: Captured chunks of stdout and stderr output, along with their associated outcomes.

anyOf.description: The status of the shell call output.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `shell_call_output`.

FunctionShellCallOutputItemParam.title: Shell tool call output

ApplyPatchToolCallItemParam.description: A tool call representing a request to create, delete, or update files using diff patches.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the apply patch tool call generated by the model.

anyOf.description: The unique ID of the apply patch tool call. Populated when this item is returned via API.

operation.description: The specific create, delete, or update instruction for the apply_patch tool call.

status.description: The status of the apply patch tool call. One of `in_progress` or `completed`.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `apply_patch_call`.

ApplyPatchToolCallItemParam.title: Apply patch tool call

ApplyPatchToolCallOutputItemParam.description: The streamed output emitted by an apply patch tool call.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the apply patch tool call generated by the model.

anyOf.description: The unique ID of the apply patch tool call output. Populated when this item is returned via API.
Optional human-readable log text from the apply patch tool (e.g., patch results or errors).

status.description: The status of the apply patch tool call output. One of `completed` or `failed`.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `apply_patch_call_output`.

ApplyPatchToolCallOutputItemParam.title: Apply patch tool call output

MCPListTools.description: A list of tools available on an MCP server.

anyOf.description: Error message if the server could not list tools.

id.description: The unique ID of the list.

server_label.description: The label of the MCP server.

tools.description: The tools available on the server.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `mcp_list_tools`.

MCPListTools.title: MCP list tools

MCPApprovalRequest.description: A request for human approval of a tool invocation.

arguments.description: A JSON string of arguments for the tool.

id.description: The unique ID of the approval request.

name.description: The name of the tool to run.

server_label.description: The label of the MCP server making the request.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `mcp_approval_request`.

MCPApprovalRequest.title: MCP approval request

MCPApprovalResponse.description: A response to an MCP approval request.

approval_request_id.description: The ID of the approval request being answered.

anyOf.description: The unique ID of the approval response
Optional reason for the decision.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `mcp_approval_response`.

MCPApprovalResponse.title: MCP approval response

MCPToolCall.description: An invocation of a tool on an MCP server.

anyOf.description:
Unique identifier for the MCP tool call approval request.
Include this value in a subsequent `mcp_approval_response` input to approve or reject the corresponding tool call.

arguments.description: A JSON string of the arguments passed to the tool.

anyOf.description: The error from the tool call, if any.

id.description: The unique ID of the tool call.

name.description: The name of the tool that was run.

anyOf.description: The output from the tool call.

server_label.description: The label of the MCP server running the tool.

status.description: The status of the tool call. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, `incomplete`, `calling`, or `failed`.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `mcp_call`.

MCPToolCall.title: MCP tool call

CustomToolCallOutput.description: The output of a custom tool call from your code, being sent back to the model.

call_id.description: The call ID, used to map this custom tool call output to a custom tool call.

id.description: The unique ID of the custom tool call output in the OpenAI platform.

output.description:
The output from the custom tool call generated by your code.
Can be a string or an list of output content.

oneOf.description: A string of the output of the custom tool call.
oneOf.title: string output

oneOf.description: Text, image, or file output of the custom tool call.
oneOf.title: output content list

type.description: The type of the custom tool call output. Always `custom_tool_call_output`.

CustomToolCallOutput.title: Custom tool call output

CustomToolCall.description: A call to a custom tool created by the model.

call_id.description: An identifier used to map this custom tool call to a tool call output.

id.description: The unique ID of the custom tool call in the OpenAI platform.

input.description: The input for the custom tool call generated by the model.

name.description: The name of the custom tool being called.

type.description: The type of the custom tool call. Always `custom_tool_call`.

CustomToolCall.title: Custom tool call

ResponseFormatText.description: Default response format. Used to generate text responses.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `text`.

ResponseFormatText.title: Text

TextResponseFormatJsonSchema.description:
JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.
Learn more about [Structured Outputs](/docs/guides/structured-outputs).

description.description:
A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to
determine how to respond in the format.

name.description:
The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain
underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

anyOf.description:
Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output.
If set to true, the model will always follow the exact schema defined
in the `schema` field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when
`strict` is `true`. To learn more, read the [Structured Outputs
guide](/docs/guides/structured-outputs).

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `json_schema`.

TextResponseFormatJsonSchema.title: JSON schema

ResponseFormatJsonObject.description:
JSON object response format. An older method of generating JSON responses.
Using `json_schema` is recommended for models that support it. Note that the
model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it
to do so.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `json_object`.

ResponseFormatJsonObject.title: JSON object

hybrid_search.description: Weights that control how reciprocal rank fusion balances semantic embedding matches versus sparse keyword matches when hybrid search is enabled.

ranker.description: The ranker to use for the file search.

score_threshold.description: The score threshold for the file search, a number between 0 and 1. Numbers closer to 1 will attempt to return only the most relevant results, but may return fewer results.

anyOf.description: The approximate location of the user.
Free text input for the city of the user, e.g. `San Francisco`.
The two-letter [ISO country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1) of the user, e.g. `US`.
Free text input for the region of the user, e.g. `California`.
The [IANA timezone](https://timeapi.io/documentation/iana-timezones) of the user, e.g. `America/Los_Angeles`.

type.description: The type of location approximation. Always `approximate`.

anyOf.title: Web search approximate location

MCPToolFilter.description: A filter object to specify which tools are allowed.

read_only.description:
Indicates whether or not a tool modifies data or is read-only. If an
MCP server is [annotated with `readOnlyHint`](https://modelcontextprotocol.io/specification/2025-06-18/schema#toolannotations-readonlyhint),
it will match this filter.

MCPToolFilter.title: MCP tool filter

AutoCodeInterpreterToolParam.description: Configuration for a code interpreter container. Optionally specify the IDs of the files to run the code on.

file_ids.description: An optional list of uploaded files to make available to your code.

anyOf.description: The memory limit for the code interpreter container.

network_policy.description: Network access policy for the container.

type.description: Always `auto`.

AutoCodeInterpreterToolParam.title: CodeInterpreterToolAuto

InputFidelity.description: Control how much effort the model will exert to match the style and features, especially facial features, of input images. This parameter is only supported for `gpt-image-1` and `gpt-image-1.5` and later models, unsupported for `gpt-image-1-mini`. Supports `high` and `low`. Defaults to `low`.

file_ids.description: An optional list of uploaded files to make available to your code.

anyOf.description: The memory limit for the container.

network_policy.description: Network access policy for the container.

skills.description: An optional list of skills referenced by id or inline data.

type.description: Automatically creates a container for this request
Use a local computer environment.

container_id.description: The ID of the referenced container.

type.description: References a container created with the /v1/containers endpoint
Unconstrained text format. Always `text`.

CustomGrammarFormatParam.description: A grammar defined by the user.

syntax.description: The syntax of the grammar definition. One of `lark` or `regex`.

type.description: Grammar format. Always `grammar`.

CustomGrammarFormatParam.title: Grammar format

anyOf.description: Free text input for the city of the user, e.g. `San Francisco`.
The two-letter [ISO country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1) of the user, e.g. `US`.
Free text input for the region of the user, e.g. `California`.
The [IANA timezone](https://timeapi.io/documentation/iana-timezones) of the user, e.g. `America/Los_Angeles`.

type.description: The type of location approximation. Always `approximate`.

anyOf.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard. Keys are strings
with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum
length of 512 characters, booleans, or numbers.

ComputerCallSafetyCheckParam.description: A pending safety check for the computer call.

anyOf.description: The type of the pending safety check.

id.description: The ID of the pending safety check.

anyOf.description: Details about the pending safety check.

ComputerScreenshotImage.description: A computer screenshot image used with the computer use tool.

file_id.description: The identifier of an uploaded file that contains the screenshot.

image_url.description: The URL of the screenshot image.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a computer screenshot, this property is 
always set to `computer_screenshot`.

WebSearchActionSearch.description: Action type "search" - Performs a web search query.

sources.description: The sources used in the search.

items.description: A source used in the search.

type.description: The type of source. Always `url`.

items.title: Web search source

sources.title: Web search sources

type.description: The action type.

WebSearchActionSearch.title: Search action

WebSearchActionOpenPage.description: Action type "open_page" - Opens a specific URL from search results.

type.description: The action type.

url.description: The URL opened by the model.

WebSearchActionOpenPage.title: Open page action

WebSearchActionFind.description: Action type "find_in_page": Searches for a pattern within a loaded page.

pattern.description: The pattern or text to search for within the page.

type.description: The action type.

url.description: The URL of the page searched for the pattern.

WebSearchActionFind.title: Find action

InputTextContentParam.description: A text input to the model.

text.description: The text input to the model.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_text`.

InputTextContentParam.title: Input text

InputImageContentParamAutoParam.description: An image input to the model. Learn about [image inputs](/docs/guides/vision)

anyOf.description: The detail level of the image to be sent to the model. One of `high`, `low`, or `auto`. Defaults to `auto`.
The ID of the file to be sent to the model.
The URL of the image to be sent to the model. A fully qualified URL or base64 encoded image in a data URL.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_image`.

InputImageContentParamAutoParam.title: Input image

InputFileContentParam.description: A file input to the model.

anyOf.description: The base64-encoded data of the file to be sent to the model.
The ID of the file to be sent to the model.
The URL of the file to be sent to the model.
The name of the file to be sent to the model.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_file`.

InputFileContentParam.title: Input file

text.description: The reasoning text from the model.

type.description: The type of the reasoning text. Always `reasoning_text`.

SummaryTextContent.description: A summary text from the model.

text.description: A summary of the reasoning output from the model so far.

type.description: The type of the object. Always `summary_text`.

SummaryTextContent.title: Summary text

CodeInterpreterOutputLogs.description: The logs output from the code interpreter.

logs.description: The logs output from the code interpreter.

type.description: The type of the output. Always `logs`.

CodeInterpreterOutputLogs.title: Code interpreter output logs

CodeInterpreterOutputImage.description: The image output from the code interpreter.

type.description: The type of the output. Always `image`.

url.description: The URL of the image output from the code interpreter.

CodeInterpreterOutputImage.title: Code interpreter output image

LocalShellExecAction.description: Execute a shell command on the server.

env.description: Environment variables to set for the command.

anyOf.description: Optional timeout in milliseconds for the command.

type.description: The type of the local shell action. Always `exec`.

anyOf.description: Optional user to run the command as.
Optional working directory to run the command in.

LocalShellExecAction.title: Local shell exec action

FunctionShellActionParam.description: Commands and limits describing how to run the shell tool call.

commands.description: Ordered shell commands for the execution environment to run.

anyOf.description: Maximum number of UTF-8 characters to capture from combined stdout and stderr output.
Maximum wall-clock time in milliseconds to allow the shell commands to run.

FunctionShellActionParam.title: Shell action

FunctionShellCallItemStatus.description: Status values reported for shell tool calls.
FunctionShellCallItemStatus.title: Shell call status

FunctionShellCallOutputContentParam.description: Captured stdout and stderr for a portion of a shell tool call output.

outcome.description: The exit or timeout outcome associated with this shell call.

stderr.description: Captured stderr output for the shell call.

stdout.description: Captured stdout output for the shell call.

FunctionShellCallOutputContentParam.title: Shell output content

ApplyPatchOperationParam.description: One of the create_file, delete_file, or update_file operations supplied to the apply_patch tool.
ApplyPatchOperationParam.title: Apply patch operation

ApplyPatchCallStatusParam.description: Status values reported for apply_patch tool calls.
ApplyPatchCallStatusParam.title: Apply patch call status

ApplyPatchCallOutputStatusParam.description: Outcome values reported for apply_patch tool call outputs.
ApplyPatchCallOutputStatusParam.title: Apply patch call output status

MCPListToolsTool.description: A tool available on an MCP server.

anyOf.description: Additional annotations about the tool.
The description of the tool.

input_schema.description: The JSON schema describing the tool's input.

MCPListToolsTool.title: MCP list tools tool

ResponseFormatJsonSchemaSchema.description:
The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.
Learn how to build JSON schemas [here](https://json-schema.org/).
ResponseFormatJsonSchemaSchema.title: JSON schema

ComparisonFilter.description: A filter used to compare a specified attribute key to a given value using a defined comparison operation.

key.description: The key to compare against the value.

type.description:
Specifies the comparison operator: `eq`, `ne`, `gt`, `gte`, `lt`, `lte`, `in`, `nin`.
- `eq`: equals
- `ne`: not equal
- `gt`: greater than
- `gte`: greater than or equal
- `lt`: less than
- `lte`: less than or equal
- `in`: in
- `nin`: not in

value.description: The value to compare against the attribute key; supports string, number, or boolean types.

ComparisonFilter.title: Comparison Filter

filters.description: Array of filters to combine. Items can be `ComparisonFilter` or `CompoundFilter`.

type.description: Type of operation: `and` or `or`.

embedding_weight.description: The weight of the embedding in the reciprocal ranking fusion.

text_weight.description: The weight of the text in the reciprocal ranking fusion.

type.description: Disable outbound network access. Always `disabled`.

allowed_domains.description: A list of allowed domains when type is `allowlist`.

domain_secrets.description: Optional domain-scoped secrets for allowlisted domains.

type.description: Allow outbound network access only to specified domains. Always `allowlist`.

skill_id.description: The ID of the referenced skill.

type.description: References a skill created with the /v1/skills endpoint.

version.description: Optional skill version. Use a positive integer or 'latest'. Omit for default.

type.description: Defines an inline skill for this request.

path.description: The path to the directory containing the skill.

InputTextContent.description: A text input to the model.

text.description: The text input to the model.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_text`.

InputTextContent.title: Input text

InputImageContent.description: An image input to the model. Learn about [image inputs](/docs/guides/vision).

detail.description: The detail level of the image to be sent to the model. One of `high`, `low`, or `auto`. Defaults to `auto`.

anyOf.description: The ID of the file to be sent to the model.
The URL of the image to be sent to the model. A fully qualified URL or base64 encoded image in a data URL.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_image`.

InputImageContent.title: Input image

InputFileContent.description: A file input to the model.

file_data.description: The content of the file to be sent to the model.

anyOf.description: The ID of the file to be sent to the model.

file_url.description: The URL of the file to be sent to the model.

filename.description: The name of the file to be sent to the model.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_file`.

InputFileContent.title: Input file

OutputTextContent.description: A text output from the model.

annotations.description: The annotations of the text output.

text.description: The text output from the model.

type.description: The type of the output text. Always `output_text`.

OutputTextContent.title: Output text

refusal.description: The refusal explanation from the model.

type.description: The type of the refusal. Always `refusal`.

button.description: Indicates which mouse button was pressed during the click. One of `left`, `right`, `wheel`, `back`, or `forward`.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a click action, this property is always `click`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the click occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the click occurred.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a double click action, this property is always set to `double_click`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the double click occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the double click occurred.

path.description:
An array of coordinates representing the path of the drag action. Coordinates will appear as an array of objects, eg
```
[
  { x: 100, y: 200 },
  { x: 200, y: 300 }
]
```

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a drag action, this property is always set to `drag`.

KeyPressAction.description: A collection of keypresses the model would like to perform.

keys.description: The combination of keys the model is requesting to be pressed. This is an array of strings, each representing a key.

items.description: One of the keys the model is requesting to be pressed.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a keypress action, this property is always set to `keypress`.

KeyPressAction.title: KeyPress

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a move action, this property is always set to `move`.
Specifies the event type. For a screenshot action, this property is always set to `screenshot`.
Specifies the event type. For a scroll action, this property is always set to `scroll`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the scroll occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the scroll occurred.

TypeParam.description: An action to type in text.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a type action, this property is always set to `type`.

TypeParam.title: Type

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a wait action, this property is always set to `wait`.

FunctionShellCallOutputOutcomeParam.description: The exit or timeout outcome associated with this shell call.
FunctionShellCallOutputOutcomeParam.title: Shell call outcome

ApplyPatchCreateFileOperationParam.description: Instruction for creating a new file via the apply_patch tool.

diff.description: Unified diff content to apply when creating the file.

path.description: Path of the file to create relative to the workspace root.

type.description: The operation type. Always `create_file`.

ApplyPatchCreateFileOperationParam.title: Apply patch create file operation

ApplyPatchDeleteFileOperationParam.description: Instruction for deleting an existing file via the apply_patch tool.

path.description: Path of the file to delete relative to the workspace root.

type.description: The operation type. Always `delete_file`.

ApplyPatchDeleteFileOperationParam.title: Apply patch delete file operation

ApplyPatchUpdateFileOperationParam.description: Instruction for updating an existing file via the apply_patch tool.

diff.description: Unified diff content to apply to the existing file.

path.description: Path of the file to update relative to the workspace root.

type.description: The operation type. Always `update_file`.

ApplyPatchUpdateFileOperationParam.title: Apply patch update file operation

domain.description: The domain associated with the secret.

name.description: The name of the secret to inject for the domain.

value.description: The secret value to inject for the domain.

media_type.description: The media type of the inline skill payload. Must be `application/zip`.

type.description: The type of the inline skill source. Must be `base64`.

Annotation.description: An annotation that applies to a span of output text.

LogProb.description: The log probability of a token.
LogProb.title: Log probability

CoordParam.description: An x/y coordinate pair, e.g. `{ x: 100, y: 200 }`.
CoordParam.title: Coordinate

FunctionShellCallOutputTimeoutOutcomePar.description: Indicates that the shell call exceeded its configured time limit.

type.description: The outcome type. Always `timeout`.

FunctionShellCallOutputTimeoutOutcomePar.title: Shell call timeout outcome

FunctionShellCallOutputExitOutcomeParam.description: Indicates that the shell commands finished and returned an exit code.

exit_code.description: The exit code returned by the shell process.

type.description: The outcome type. Always `exit`.

FunctionShellCallOutputExitOutcomeParam.title: Shell call exit outcome

filename.description: The filename of the file cited.

index.description: The index of the file in the list of files.

type.description: The type of the file citation. Always `file_citation`.

UrlCitationBody.description: A citation for a web resource used to generate a model response.

end_index.description: The index of the last character of the URL citation in the message.

start_index.description: The index of the first character of the URL citation in the message.

title.description: The title of the web resource.

type.description: The type of the URL citation. Always `url_citation`.

url.description: The URL of the web resource.

UrlCitationBody.title: URL citation

ContainerFileCitationBody.description: A citation for a container file used to generate a model response.

container_id.description: The ID of the container file.

end_index.description: The index of the last character of the container file citation in the message.

filename.description: The filename of the container file cited.

start_index.description: The index of the first character of the container file citation in the message.

type.description: The type of the container file citation. Always `container_file_citation`.

ContainerFileCitationBody.title: Container file citation

index.description: The index of the file in the list of files.

type.description: The type of the file path. Always `file_path`.

TopLogProb.description: The top log probability of a token.
TopLogProb.title: Top log probability
